result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. RICKY F. REIERSON

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on January 5, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Voir Dire List

8:31 Defendant RICKY F. REIERSON in court.  Attorney Michael Lim in court for RICKY F. REIERSON.  Prosecuting attorney Tucker T. Tellefson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Case was set for Jury Trial today.  The State discovered late yesterday afternoon, one of the officer's body cam footage was mislabeled, so it was not provided in discovery.  The State is having the footage downloaded now, and it will be sent over on a flash drive ASAP.  Video appears to be 17 minutes.  The Court will recess to allow the State and Defense to watch the video this morning before making a decision about going forward with trial today.  No objections.  RECESS 8:36. RECALLED 9:18 After watching the video, attorney Lim requests to reschedule the Jury Trial but requests to set for a status hearing prior to scheduling a Jury Trial.
Status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

10:35 AM Defendant RICKY F. REIERSON in court.  Attorney Michael Lim in court for RICKY F. REIERSON.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Leave on for Jury Trial.  Bond Continues. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.

CONDITIONS:  Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. Defendant shall contact (920)232-1919 IMMEDIATELY after their court hearing to schedule an appointment to be set up on the program.  If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  The defendant shall bring the Alcohol Monitoring Device to every hearing.

1:37 PM Prosecuting attorney David C. Rashid in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant RICKY F. REIERSON appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Lim not in court.  24/7 VIOLATION.  Advised of rights. Defendant waives his/her right to an attorney for this hearing.  The State requests to increase bond by an additional $500 cash.  The DE agrees.  The Court will increase bond by $500 for a total of $750.The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.

records.addlTxt: 08:32 AM Defendant RICKY F. REIERSON in court with attorney Michael Lim.  Tracy Ann Paider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lim requests another FP date 30 days out. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law to hear bond.  The State requests the 24/7 remian.  The Court will not amend bond.  Bond Continues.
